original_solution_mapping.L1: Angela has 8 more marbles than Allison who has 28 so Angela has 8+28 = <<8+28=36>>36 marbles
original_solution_mapping.L2: Albert has three times as many marbles as Angela who has 36 so Albert has 3*36 = <<3*36=108>>108 marbles
original_solution_mapping.L3: Albert and Allison together have 108+28 = <<108+28=136>>136 marbles

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5649.
    Returns: the total number of marbles Albert and Allison have.
    """
    # L1
    angela_more_than_allison = 8 # 8 more than Allison
    allison_marbles = 28 # who has 28 marbles
    angela_marbles = angela_more_than_allison + allison_marbles

    # L2
    albert_multiplier = 3 # three times as many marbles as Angela
    albert_marbles = albert_multiplier * angela_marbles

    # L3
    total_marbles_albert_allison = albert_marbles + allison_marbles

    # FA
    answer = total_marbles_albert_allison
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Angela has {angela_more_than_allison} more marbles than Allison who has {allison_marbles} so Angela has {angela_more_than_allison}+{allison_marbles} = <<{angela_more_than_allison}+{allison_marbles}={angela_marbles}>>{angela_marbles} marbles

Albert has three times as many marbles as Angela who has {angela_marbles} so Albert has {albert_multiplier}*{angela_marbles} = <<{albert_multiplier}*{angela_marbles}={albert_marbles}>>{albert_marbles} marbles
Albert and Allison together have {albert_marbles}+{allison_marbles} = <<{albert_marbles}+{allison_marbles}={total_marbles_albert_allison}>>{total_marbles_albert_allison} marbles

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Angela has 8 more marbles than Allison who has 28 so Angela has 8+28 = <<8+28=36>>36 marbles
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Albert has three times as many marbles as Angela who has 36 so Albert has 3*36 = <<3*36=39>>39 marbles
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Albert and Allison together have 39+28 = <<39+28=67>>67 marbles

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '*' but used '+' instead.
